stories.text: Hello everyone. What's the security solution or software (private or open source) some of you here at HN would recommend most for deeply protecting a personal PC or laptop as free as possible of malware, spyware and so forth? Plenty of commercial options exist obviously, but my suspicion of their qualities and own business-related data-grubbing and clumsiness has gone nowhere but up in recent years. Any suggestions would be very helpful.
stories.title: Ask HN: What's the personal computer security solution you recommend most?

stories.text: I haven't kept up with it. I have been using Signal for a long, long time. My EU friends really aren't going to make that switch it seems, so, I'd rather use WhatsApp than nothing. But, what's the story recently? Any significant privacy changes to know about in either direction?
stories.title: Ask HN: What's the story with WhatsApp privacy these days?
We automated user insights by connecting slack, a database and our own dogfood

stories.text:
Specifically I am speaking to the non-mobile web experience but this discussion can include that as well.

Is it just me or is the page load times and response time worse now than it was 5-10+ years ago? This is something I continue to notice across multiple machines and varying internet access speeds/latencies.
stories.title: Ask HN: Is the web slower to load nowadays or is it just me?
